Create a point geometry

Source: R/geometries.R
geomPoint.Rd

Create a point geometry

geomPoint(anchor = NULL, window = NULL, template = NULL,
  vertices = NULL, show = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

anchor

[data.frame(1)]
Object to derive the geom from. It must include column names x, y and optinal variables such as fid; see Examples.
window

[data.frame(1)]
in case the reference window deviates from the bounding box of anchor (minimum and maximum values), specify this here.
template

[RasterLayer(1) | matrix(1)]
Gridded object that serves as template to sketch the geometry.
vertices

[integer(1)]
number of vertices.
show

[logical(1)]
in case template is set, should the points be plotted (TRUE) or should it not be plotted (FALSE, default)?
...

[various]
graphical parameter, in case show = TRUE; see gpar.

Value

An invisible geom.

See also

Tools to modify geometries: gRotate, gScale, gGroup
Tools to transform geometries to other classes: gToSp, gToSf, gToRaster, gFrom

Other shapes: geomPolygon, geomRand

Examples

# create points programmatically
somePoints <- data.frame(X = c(5190599, 5222810, 5041066, 5234735,
                         5326537, 5027609, 5281527, 5189955), Y = c(3977612,
                         4060164, 3997230, 4117856, 4028167, 3971119, 4118207,
                         4062838))
(pointsGeom <- geomPoint(anchor = somePoints, col = "darkorange", show = TRUE))
#> class      : geom
#> type       : point
#> features   : 8  (8 vertices)
#> window     : 5027609, 5326537, 3971119, 4118207  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> extent     : 5027609, 5326537, 3971119, 4118207  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax)
#> scale      : absolute
#> crs        : NA
#> attributes : 2  (fid, n)


# NOT RUN {
input <- rtData$continuous

# create points interactively
myPoints <- geomPoint(template = input, vertices = 5, show = TRUE, col = "deeppink")
myPoints <- gGroup(myPoints, index = rep(1, 5))
anExtent <- geomRectangle(myPoints, show = TRUE, col = "green")
# }
